thread.title: Simon Cowell wants to turn 60 in the X Factor chair
thread.title_full: Simon Cowell wants to turn 60 in the X Factor chair

title: Simon Cowell wants to turn 60 in the X Factor chair
text:
Simon Cowell wants to turn 60 in the X Factor chair Simon Cowell wants to turn 60 in the X Factor chair 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Simon Cowell insisted he is not retiring any time soon and said he wants to be in the X Factor chair for another 10 years. 
He says the show, which has been running for more than a decade, has a “passionate and loyal audience” and claims viewing figures are up after a shaky opening week. 
“Would I like to be celebrating my 60th birthday with X Factor still on air? Yes I would,” the 56-year-old told The Sun. Presumably the rest of the judging line-up will be changing over the next four years, though (Daniel Leal-Olivas/PA) 
“I wouldn’t worry about the future of X Factor. We’re going to be fine. 
“If we’re still here in 10 years’ time, we’ll have a very large celebration.” Share article 
Tonight will be a test of fans’ loyalty when the X Factor will clash with its main rival Strictly Come Dancing. Promoted Stories
